perturbation.original_text: 5.3 Royalty/Commission Payments. Dr. Murray will receive an annual royalty on net sales (defined as gross sales minus returns) for any products (the "Dr. Murray Products") developed by Dr. Murray for EHN for as long as the Dr. Murray Products are being sold. The Dr. Murray Products will be listed on Schedule A attached hereto as they are developed and added to product portfolio. During each year of this agreement, Dr. Murray will be paid no later than the 30st day of January based on the cumulative Net Sales of the Dr. Murray Products for the preceding 12 months based upon the following scale:
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3 Royalty/Commission Payments. Dr. Murray will receive an annual royalty on net sales (defined as gross sales minus returns) for any products (the "Dr. Murray Products") developed by Dr. Murray for EHN for as long as the Dr. Murray Products are being sold. The Dr. Murray Products will be listed on Schedule A attached hereto as they are developed and added to product portfolio. During each year of this agreement, Dr. Murray will be paid no later than the 30st day of April based on the cumulative Net Sales of the Dr. Murray Products for the preceding 12 months based upon the following scale:
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by modifying the payment deadline for royalty payments. The original text specifies a payment date of 'January 30st', which is assumed to mean January 30th. The modified text changes this to 'April 30st', again assumed to mean April 30th. This directly conflicts with the original payment deadline, creating uncertainty about when Dr. Murray is entitled to receive royalty payments.

perturbation.original_text: 6.1 Term. This Agreement shall become effective as of the Effective Date and shall remain in effect as follows. (a) Dr. Murray's obligations set out herein shall be performed from the Effective Date until December 31, 2018 (the initial "Services Term"). The Services Term of this Agreement shall be automatically renewed for successive two-year terms thereafter unless written notice is given by either party to the other, indicating that party's intention not to renew the Services Term of this Agreement, at least ninety (90) days prior to the end of the initial Services Term or any renewed Services Term. (b) Except as otherwise stated herein as pertaining only to a Services Term, this Agreement shall remain in effect for ten years, unless terminated in accordance with Sections 6.1 (a) or 6.2(b). For the avoidance of doubt, it is the intent of the parties that subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein, the royalty payments set out above shall continue in perpetuity for as long as the Dr. Murray Products are being sold.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 Term. This Agreement shall become effective as of the Effective Date and shall remain in effect as follows. (a) Dr. Murray's obligations set out herein shall be performed from the Effective Date until December 31, 2018 (the initial "Services Term"). The Services Term of this Agreement shall be automatically renewed for successive two-year terms thereafter unless written notice is given by either party to the other, indicating that party's intention not to renew the Services Term of this Agreement, at least thirty (30) days prior to the end of the initial Services Term or any renewed Services Term. (b) Except as otherwise stated herein as pertaining only to a Services Term, this Agreement shall remain in effect for ten years, unless terminated in accordance with Sections 6.1 (a) or 6.2(b). For the avoidance of doubt, it is the intent of the parties that subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein, the royalty payments set out above shall continue in perpetuity for as long as the Dr. Murray Products are being sold.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a conflict in the termination clause. The original agreement requires a 90-day written notice for non-renewal of the Services Term. The modified text reduces this notice period to 30 days. This directly contradicts the original term, making it unclear which notice period applies for terminating the Services Term. This uncertainty can lead to disputes regarding the validity of termination notices.

perturbation.original_text: 8 -- NOTICES All notices, communications, payments or other correspondence required to be given or made under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed received (a) on the same day if delivered in person, courier service, confirmed e-mail delivery, or facsimile transmission, (b) on the next day if delivered by next day Federal Express, UPS, or other reputable overnight carrier, or (c) within three (3) days if delivered by mail. All notices shall be given to the parties at the following addresses, or such other addresses as may be the subject of a notice given hereunder:
perturbation.changed_text: 8 -- NOTICES All notices, communications, payments or other correspondence required to be given or made under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed received (a) on the same day if delivered in person, courier service, confirmed e-mail delivery, or facsimile transmission, (b) on the third day if delivered by next day Federal Express, UPS, or other reputable overnight carrier, or (c) within three (3) days if delivered by mail. All notices shall be given to the parties at the following addresses, or such other addresses as may be the subject of a notice given hereunder:
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction concerning when notices delivered via overnight carrier are considered 'received.' The original clause states that such notices are deemed received 'on the next day.' However, the modified clause alters this to 'on the third day.' This in-text contradiction creates ambiguity and uncertainty regarding the effective date of notices delivered by overnight carrier. For example, if a notice of termination is sent by overnight carrier, the recipient might claim that it was not effectively received until the third day, potentially affecting the timing of termination and creating disputes.
